name: Touhoumerun Derby: Tenshi's Danmaku Dreamteam
description:
USE SPACEBAR AND ARROW KEYS AS SUBSTITUTES FOR CONTROLLER INPUTS!

Build Power in Mini-Game #1 by repeatedly mashing the ( B ) button on your controller. 

Use the D-Pad in Mini-Game #2 to dodge the fiery Danmaku and preserve your built up power. 

Finally, press the ( X ) button at just the right moment to send the ball sailing! 

The HTML5 embedded version is not perfect and will occasionally feature stutter in the audio or loss of keyboard focus. For the optimal experience, please download the .zip associated with your OS.

Special thanks to Sephi | @twisted_limbo | https://twisted-limbo.itch.io/ for the amazing cover art and incredible character sprites! Holy crap! You rule!

Special thanks to @wb_shiro for the Japanese translations! You're the best!

Credits:

Programming | Graphics | Design | Music | SFX - Kytra S.

Character Sprites | Cover Art | Additional Artwork - Sephi / @twisted_limbo / https://twisted-limbo.itch.io/

Japanese Translations - @wb_shiro

Moral Support and Play-Testing - Poxiva and Gubbles

Story: 

It seems Tenshi is having a bad time after Yukari is forced to deal with Tenshi's 'peach season antics' by employing a well-placed portal to the outside world. Tenshi gets blasted into-next-week by an object that will soon test her ability to wield a weapon most suited for the job. What that job is exactly is anyone's guess! Try not to get distracted by the overwhelming cuteness of Dreamworld Sanae as she hurls baseballs and bullets at Tenshi. Hone your reflexes as Tenshi swings for the fences with the Gensokyo-Slugger of Hisou. 

This game features a short series of reflex testing & button-mashing mini-games where your performance determines how hard Tenshi will strike each pitch!

The executable that includes the tag "jam-submission" is representative of the state of the game when the jam submission deadline came to an end. 

I had a blast making this tiny sports related, injury-induced adventure and will continue to polish its elements as time goes on.

Thank you so much for playing!

Things still left to polish:

-Linux Support

-Some SFX missing.

- Some artwork un-colored or un-shaded. 

-Some elements of the Stadium are missing.

-Animation timings could be improved.
